etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French entrelacier, from entre- ‘between’ + lacier ‘to lace’

definitions: cross or be crossed intricately together; interweave

examples.text: Jane interlaced her fingers to form a cup.

shortDefinitions: cross or be crossed intricately together

examples.text: buttercups interlacing their gold with the silver of the daisies

definitions: scan (a video image) in such a way that alternate lines form one sequence which is followed by the other lines in a second sequence

examples.text: you need different software to interlace the images

shortDefinitions: scan video image in such way that alternate lines form one sequence which is followed by other lines in second sequence
